Yes, that's true. The pandemic has highlighted the need to re-evaluate our priorities, and it has emphasized the importance of sustainability, well-being, and equitable development. Governments and companies are starting to recognize the need for resilient and sustainable systems that prioritize the health, safety, and well-being of people and the environment.

By prioritizing sustainability and well-being, companies and governments can create long-term value, reduce risks, and promote equitable and inclusive growth. Moreover, they can create a robust and resilient society that can withstand future crises.

Therefore, it is a positive trend that we are seeing a shift towards sustainability and well-being in policy-making, business models, and consumer behavior. It reflects a broader realization that the pursuit of economic growth alone is not enough to create a sustainable and equitable society. We need to prioritize sustainability and well-being to build a better world for all.
